title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye for appearing 'timid' in the season-opening loss to the Raiders.
Drake Maye completed 14-of-20 passes for 150 yards and a touchdown in the first half against the Raiders.
New England's offense struggled in the second half, leading to a 20-13 loss to the Raiders at Gillette Stadium.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, died after being struck by an e-bike in Copley Square on August 6.
The collision occurred in front of the Boston Public Library near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street.
Police reported the e-bike operator stayed at the scene and no charges have been filed so far.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience king tides, also known as perigean spring tides, with water levels two to four feet higher.
King tides occur when the moon's orbit and phases align, increasing gravitational pull and causing elevated tides.
The Stone Living Lab and National Park Service host events to observe king tides this fall at Boston's Long Wharf.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye, emphasizing his ability to handle criticism and improve.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in loss to Raiders.
Stefon Diggs made his Patriots debut with six catches for 57 yards after recovering from an ACL tear.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A state audit found the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education didn't investigate 22 supported child abuse reports.
Audit revealed DESE failed to resolve special education complaints within the 60-day requirement, averaging 111-day delays.
DESE did not issue LGBTQ materials or provide necessary training to school districts as required, audit found.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, conservative activist, was fatally shot during a political event at Utah Valley University.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey, condemned the shooting and denounced political violence in statements.
Authorities arrested and released a suspect in the shooting; no further suspects are believed to be involved.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains out of practice due to a hamstring injury since July 28.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses miss practice with foot issues, adding to Patriots' injury concerns.
Wide receiver Kayshon Boutte was limited in practice with a shoulder injury after a strong Week 1 performance.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye admits some rushed throws during the Patriots' season-opener loss to the Raiders at Foxborough.
Patriots succeeded in time of possession but were 1-for-3 in red zone efficiency against Las Vegas.
Coach Mike Vrabel assesses potential workload for Maye while adjusting to Josh McDaniels’s offense.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown has four years left on his Celtics contract after signing a $304 million supermax extension in 2023.
Brown expressed openness to potentially playing for the Atlanta Hawks during a radio interview on V-103 FM.
He will assume a leadership role on the Celtics with Jayson Tatum injured and recent team roster changes.

title: What’s causing vibration in my 15-year-old car?
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2010 Mazda Miata owner experiences front-end vibration at highway speeds and considers tire balancing.
The car, used seasonally, might have tire flat spots or wheel issues contributing to the vibration.
Tire inspection and suspension checks are recommended for diagnosing the cause of vibration.
